column2: Oh, I'm going out into the world to try and get a place, said the lad.

column2: So the lad stopped with him, and lived on the fat of the land, both in meat and drink, and had little or nothing to do; but he never saw a living soul in that man's house.

column2: Some time after the man set off again, and said he should be away fourteen days; but before he went he forbade the lad to go into any of the rooms he had not been in before; as for that he had been in, he might go into that, and welcome.

column2: But when the lad came up the battle had begun, and the _King_ was in a sad pinch; but no sooner had the lad rushed into the thick of it than the foe was beaten back, and put to flight.
column3: But when the lad came up the battle had begun, and the underscore King underscore was in a sad pinch; but no sooner had the lad rushed into the thick of it than the foe was beaten back, and put to flight.

column2: The _King_ and his men wondered and wondered who it could be who had come to help them, but none of them got so near him as to be able to talk to him, and as soon as the fight was over he was gone.
column3: The underscore King underscore and his men wondered and wondered who it could be who had come to help them, but none of them got so near him as to be able to talk to him, and as soon as the fight was over he was gone.

column2: When they went back, there sat the lad still in the bog, and dug his spurs into his three-legged hack, and they all laughed again.
column3: When they went back, there sat the lad still in the bog, and dug his spurs into his three legged hack, and they all laughed again.

column2: No! only just look, they said; "there the fool sits still."
column3: No! only just look, they said; "there the fool sits still."

column2: The next day when they went out to battle, they saw the lad sitting there still, so they laughed again, and made game of him; but as soon as ever they had ridden by, the lad ran again to the lime-tree, and all happened as on the first day.
column3: The next day when they went out to battle, they saw the lad sitting there still, so they laughed again, and made game of him; but as soon as ever they had ridden by, the lad ran again to the lime tree, and all happened as on the first day.

column2: Every one wondered what strange champion it could be that had helped them, but no one got so near him as to say a word to him; and no one guessed it could be the lad; that's easy to understand.
column3: Every one wondered what strange champion it could be that had helped them, but no one got so near him as to say a word to him; and no one guessed it could be the lad; that's easy to understand.

column2: So when they went home at night, and saw the lad still sitting there on his hack, they burst out laughing at him again, and one of them shot an arrow at him and hit him in the leg.
column3: So when they went home at night, and saw the lad still sitting there on his hack, they burst out laughing at him again, and one of them shot an arrow at him and hit him in the leg.

column2: So he began to shriek and to bewail; 'twas enough to break one's heart; and so the _King_ threw his pocket-handkerchief to him to bind his wound.
column3: So he began to shriek and to bewail; 'twas enough to break one's heart; and so the underscore King underscore threw his pocket handkerchief to him to bind his wound.

column2: When they went out to battle the third day, the lad still sat there.
column3: When they went out to battle the third day, the lad still sat there.

column2: Gee up! gee up! he said to his hack.
column3: Gee up! gee up! he said to his hack.

column2: Nay, nay, said the _King's_ men; "if he won't stick there till he's starved to death."
column3: Nay, nay, said the underscore King's underscore men; "if he won't stick there till he's starved to death."

column2: And then they rode on, and laughed at him till they were fit to fall from their horses.
column3: And then they rode on, and laughed at him till they were fit to fall from their horses.

column2: When they were gone, he ran again to the lime, and came up to the battle just in the very nick of time.
column3: When they were gone, he ran again to the lime, and came up to the battle just in the very nick of time.

column2: This day he slew the enemy's king, and then the war was over at once.
column3: This day he slew the enemy's king, and then the war was over at once.

column2: When the battle was over, the _King_ caught sight of his handkerchief, which the strange warrior had bound round his leg, and so it wasn't hard to find him out.
column3: When the battle was over, the underscore King underscore caught sight of his handkerchief, which the strange warrior had bound round his leg, and so it wasn't hard to find him out.

column2: So they took him with great joy between them to the palace, and the _Princess_, who saw him from her window, got so glad, no one can believe it.
column3: So they took him with great joy between them to the palace, and the underscore Princess underscore, who saw him from her window, got so glad, no one can believe it.

column2: Here comes my own true love, she said.
column3: Here comes my own true love, she said.

column2: Then he took the pot of ointment and rubbed himself on the leg, and after that he rubbed all the wounded, and so they all got well again in a moment.
column3: Then he took the pot of ointment and rubbed himself on the leg, and after that he rubbed all the wounded, and so they all got well again in a moment.

column2: So he got the _Princess_ to wife; but when he went down into the stable where his horse was on the day the wedding was to be, there it stood so dull and heavy, and hung its ears down, and wouldn't eat its corn.
column3: So he got the underscore Princess underscore to wife; but when he went down into the stable where his horse was on the day the wedding was to be, there it stood so dull and heavy, and hung its ears down, and wouldn't eat its corn.

column2: So when the young _King_--for he was now a king, and had got half the kingdom--spoke to him, and asked what ailed him, the _Horse_ said:
column3: So when the young underscore King underscore--for he was now a king, and had got half the kingdom-spoke to him, and asked what ailed him, the underscore Horse underscore said:

column2: Now I have helped you on, and now I won't live any longer.	Now I have helped you on, and now I won't live any longer.
column3: true

column2: So just take the sword, and cut my head off."
column3: So just take the sword, and cut my head off."

column2: No, I'll do nothing of the kind, said the young _King_; "but you shall have all you want, and rest all your life."
column3: No, I'll do nothing of the kind, said the young underscore King underscore; "but you shall have all you want, and rest all your life."

column2: Well, said the _Horse_, "if you don't do as I tell you, see if I don't take your life somehow."
column3: Well, said the underscore Horse underscore, "if you don't do as I tell you, see if I don't take your life somehow."

column2: So the _King_ had to do what he asked; but when he swung the sword and was to cut his head off, he was so sorry he turned away his face, for he would not see the stroke fall.
column3: So the underscore King underscore had to do what he asked; but when he swung the sword and was to cut his head off, he was so sorry he turned away his face, for he would not see the stroke fall.

column2: But as soon as ever he had cut off the head, there stood the loveliest _Prince_ on the spot where the horse had stood.
column3: But as soon as ever he had cut off the head, there stood the loveliest underscore Prince underscore on the spot where the horse had stood.

column2: Why, where in all the world did you come from? asked the _King_.
column3: Why, where in all the world did you come from? asked the underscore King underscore.

column2: It was I who was a horse, said the _Prince_; "for I was king of that land whose king you slew yesterday.
column3: It was I who was a horse, said the underscore Prince underscore; "for I was king of that land whose king you slew yesterday.

column2: He it was who threw this _Troll's_ shape over me, and sold me to the _Troll_.
column3: He it was who threw this underscore Troll's underscore shape over me, and sold me to the underscore Troll underscore.

column2: But now he is slain I get my own again, and you and I will be neighbour kings, but war we will never make on one another."
column3: But now he is slain I get my own again, and you and I will be neighbour kings, but war we will never make on one another."
